Hi all! Please follow Newfield Elementary School Garden Club for Garden updates.

Newfield Elementary School Garden Club
April 2 at 10:58 AM ·

Hello, Newfield Elementary School gardeners! I hope you are all staying safe and healthy. I started planning our garden in early March and purchased some seeds at that time. I am going to show you some of those as I start them indoors, but we are also being creative at our house and using kitchen scraps to start plants. Pictured here are seeds that I scooped out of a squash purchased from the supermarket! I did not know if they would sprout, but stuck them in some dirt anyway! You can see almost ALL of them are growing in just under a week!

What scraps from your kitchen can be planted or put in water to encourage roots? I have carrots and scallions thriving in my kitchen. Try an avocado pit or celery! What other ideas do you have? share your pics.

We put a tiny amount of dirt in old egg cartons and created a greenhouse from an old salad container. What can you recycle in your house to start seeds?

Happy Gardening! -jenn c.

Join Random Hacks of Kindness Junior at their upcoming hackathon on June 2.

The core mission of the program is to expose 4-8th graders to kindness and social good through the lens of technology. We are more interested in the creation of technology, specifically the ideation and design process as it applies to a local community nonprofit. We also focus on the soft skills of collaboration and cooperation. During the program the students work in groups of 3-4 where they are paired up with computer science mentors and community nonprofits to create prototype (sample) smartphone apps for the nonprofits.
